data.title: Untitled Document
data.text:
NETWORKS: Westwood One Extends The Mark Levin Show Through 2020

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– Westwood One announces the long-term extension of the nationally syndicated talk program "The Mark Levin Show" through 2020. The fast- growing show covers the most important legal and political events of the day and has become one of the top five most-listened-to programs, reaching a listener base of millions on over 300 stations across the nation. "I am delighted to continue working with Cumulus and Westwood One and look forward to further developing the show over the next five years," Levin said. "Mark has established himself as a pillar in talk radio with his sharp and witty commentary, and we look forward to expanding his program's reach," said John Dickey, Executive Vice President of Content and Programming for Cumulus. In 2003, "The Mark Levin Show" launched on flagship station 77 WABC Radio in New York in the competitive 6:00PM - 8:00PM primetime slot, skyrocketing to #1 on the AM dial within the show's first 18 months on the air. In 2009, a third hour was added to the broadcast to keep up with the demand from his radio affiliates and fans for even more original content. Prior to launching his radio career, Levin worked as an attorney in the private sector and as a top advisor and administrator to several members of President Reagan's cabinet.

[WATCH] Radio Host Being Called Hero After Coming To The Aid Of Injured Police Officer

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– A Las Vegas radio host is being called a hero after coming to the aid of a police officer who was the victim of a hit and run. Miles Farlow, a host n KCEP FM 881.1 and Michael Gutierrez say they both stopped to aid a police officer who fell of his motorcycle earlier this week on a local Interstate highway. The crash occurred about 8:30 p.m.near an off-ramp. According to Fox 5 Las Vegas, the patrolman was traveling southbound along I-15 when a driver hit his motorcycle and then fled. Farlow witnessed the car swerve and hit the motorcycle officer. 'The officer went flying at least 30 yards, 90 feet,' Farlow said. After being ejected from his bike, the officer's head hit the concrete barrier wall. Farlow ran over to help, attempting to calm him down until help arrived. "I wasn't really scared. I wasn't worried about anything besides getting him safe because he can't help. Another man, Michael Gutierrez, also ran to his aid. Farlow said he doesn't consider himself a hero. He was just doing what anyone should do in the situation. "It hurts, and it's shocking to realize there are so few people in this world that will actually do that, that will actually put their life on the line to help another life," he said. PHOTO/screengrab - WATCH VIDEO HERE

625 Stations Later, The Mix Group Hits 12-Year Milestone

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– From one client-station in 2003 to 625 stations today, The Mix Group, is now celebrating its 12-year anniversary. Reaching this milestone is a testament to our special friend and long-time supporter, The Mix Group Founder and President, Jason Garte. Based in Miami with a full-time production team of 18 seasoned radio imaging producers and an in-house production director to streamline operations, Garte attributes the success and longevity of his company to his talented team and his obsession with quality control. “My passion for our business is insatiable,” says Garte. “Because of that, I surround myself with only the best in the business. Our Mix Group family is exactly that – family. We love what we do and love doing it together as we push to exceed our clients’ expectations and blow their minds.” From soup-to-nuts, The Mix Group creates 100 percent custom imaging for all broadcast partners from promos and sweepers to legal identifications and music beds. Their affiliate roster covers an extensive variety of popular radio formats and features such stations as KXOL-FM Mega 96.3 (Los Angeles), WPWX-FM Power 92.3 (Chicago), and WFEZ-FM Easy 93.1 (Miami). In addition, The Mix Group has provided voice-over services since 2005. To meet the growing demand for those services, Garte launched Mix Talent Management, Inc. in 2009. Today, that stable of 35 blue-ribbon talents include the likes of Scott Matthews, Eric Edwards, Rick Party and Brian Christopher. Jason also hits another milestone tomorrow, January 30th is his birthday. Jockline extends our warmest congratulations to Jason on reaching his company's 12th year, and wishes him a happy birthday.

WWO Sports Joins With Over 100 Media Outlets For SB XLIX

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– Westwood One Sports is busy behind the scenes this week at Super Bowl Radio Row, where nearly 100 media outlets from around the country are set up remotely to broadcast live. Current and former NFL players and coaches, athletes, and celebrities all come through Radio Row during the week for one-on-one interviews. Westwood One will broadcast Super Bowl XLIX this Sunday, February 1.

Women In Media Name New Chair; Begin Review Of Gracie Entries

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– The Alliance for Women in Media (AWM) announced that Kristen Welch, SVP, Global Content Operations at Discovery Communications. in Silver Spring, Md., as the 2015 National Chair. She takes over from past National Chair Kay Olin, Principle, Kay Olin & Associates. Kristen Welch is SVP, Global Content Operations for Discovery Communications. After their meeting, the board participated in judging the 2015 Gracies entries on January 24 and 25 at the National Press Club in Washington, D.C. “I am honored to take over the role of AWM National Chair,” said Welch. “The AWM Board of Directors is united in its mission to empower career development, facilitate conversations about the state of women in the media industry and celebrate the success of like-minded causes. We couldn’t have a better group of women to lead this charge.” Serving as ChairâElect of AWM is Sarah Foss, Vice President of Product Management and Media at Imagine Communications, New York, N.Y. The Treasurer is Keisha Sutton-James, Vice President, Inner City Broadcasting Corp., New York, N.Y.; the TreasurerâElect is Christine Travaglini, President, Christal Radio/KRG Partnerships, New York, N.Y. and Past Chair is Kay Olin. Among the individuals who will serve as Directors at Large, include Robin Alston, Director of Business & Legal Affairs, Karla Ballard, SVP, Heather Cohen (R), EVP, The Weiss Agency, Sandy Girard, Vice President, Brand Management and Development, SiriusXM Radio, New York, N.Y.; Susie Hedrick, VP, Radio Sales, Wide Orbit, Inc.; Laura Martinez, Senior Director, Affiliate Sales, Westwood One, Washington, D.C.; Christine Merritt, Columbus, Ohio; Deborah Parenti, Executive Vice President of Radio, Radio Ink/RBR/TVBR, New York, N.Y.; and Josie Thomas, Executive Vice President & Chief Diversity Officer, CBS Corporation, New York, N.Y.

Pandora Creates Seattle And Boston Group's Radio Stations

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– First it was stations banning music of bands that hailed from cities where their NFL rival played. Now, it's your own Pandora station to fill you with music from your hometown stars. For Seattle, it's acts like Hendrix, Nirvana, Macklemore and others, all available on the music streaming platform a a “Go Seahawks” station that features tunes performed by artists from the Seattle region says geekwire. Artists include Seattle’s own Jimi Hendrix, Nirvana, Death Cab for Cutie, Temple of the Dog, Foo Fighters, Macklemore, and Sir Mix-a-Lot. Pandora also created a “Go Patriots” station to celebrate that other team playing on Sunday. Musicians include Aerosmith, Guster, Staind, The Dropkick Murphys, The Cars, Dinosaur Jr., and, of course, Boston. Geekwire asks: 'We already know which city has the better football team, but which has the best musicians? - CARE TO WEIGH IN? Let us know HERE

WHO's Simon Conway Flashes Lights During Interview With DOT Official In Mock Protest

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– Talker Simon Conway is usually lighting up the phone lines at 1040 WHO Des Moines from callers, but yesterday it was a guest he was lighting up - so to speak. He tells Jockline, 'There's strange goings on in Iowa! The State's DOT wants to run a pilot program to put blue and white lights on the back of snow plows to see if that reduces wrecks involving the vehicles. Not only will this cost a staggering $250,000,' says Conway, 'but before it can happen it requires the approval of a minimum of 77 lawmakers including the Governor. 'I don't tolerate stupid very easily,' says Conway. And to make his point, when he had State Senator Mark Chelgren in his studio yesterday, he placed two blue and white lights next to him and invited his listeners to watch on his show's web cam. "We needed no approval and it didn't cost a Dime", he said. "Mark was a good sport too," he said, 'conducting the entire interview with these lights spinning in front of him." Conway has now launched a campaign to get the Iowa DOT to use data from four similar pilot studies around the country thereby saving the State hard cash!

94WIP Philly's Wingbowl 23 Now Officially In Progress

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– The weigh-in begins today as SportsRadio 94WIP’s Al Morganti, Rhea Hughes and eaters prepare for Wing Bowl 23. 29 eaters are scheduled to appear to record their official “eating” weight and record their age, height, and hometown. Members from each eater’s entourage plus dozens of Wingettes (Bella and Melissa shown) will be on hand to cheer on their favorite eaters to victory. It begins at Chickie’s and Pete’s in south Philly. Tomorrow, January 30th, last year’s champion, Molly Schuyler, Nacho from the Wahlburgers, and one of the highest ranked eaters in the country, Patrick Bertoletti, will compete against the field of local eaters. Plus returning this year is the college division. A portion of the proceeds from Wing Bowl 23 will benefit local charities including the Fraternal Order of Police Survivors Fund.Tickets are sold out to the event, as it continues to be one of the world’s largest wing eating competitions. The best way to follow WIP’s Wing Bowl 23 is by listening live on 94WIP, over the Internet at cbsphilly.com or through mobile devices. The overall winner of Wing Bowl 23 wins a 2015 Harley-Davidson FLSTF Softail Fat Boy Motorcycle, along with $10,000 in cash and a Wing Bowl 23 Championship ring. For the first time ever, SportsRadio 94WIP and a local Jewelerwill give $10,000 cash to the Overall Runner-Up as well. This makes it a $20,000 grand total of cash provided by Steven Singer Jewelers. Once again, WIP has two cars up for grabs: one for the top Local Eater and one for the top College Eater. The Wing Bowl 23 Local Winner has the chance to win a Chrysler 300 and the Collegiate Eater will win a Chrysler 200. The Wingette of the Year walks away with $5000. For more information, go to www.wingbowl23.com.

TOP NEWS FROM AROUND THE WORLD

Taylor Swift To Headline Radio One's 'Big Weekend'

By Graham Mack

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 29TH, 2015 –– BBC Radio 1 Big Weekend has been revealed by Nick Grimshaw on the Breakfast Show. The station is heading to Norwich for the annual event. Taylor Swift has been announced as one of the acts on 23 and 24 May. Nick also broke the news that local Norfolk act ‘Context’, who was first discovered through BBC Introducing, will perform at Radio 1’s Big Weekend in May. Radio 1’s Big Weekend is now in its 12th year and will be produced this year in partnership with Norwich City Council.

BBC Radio Bristol AM Switch-Off - The BBC has started its latest AM closure, affecting the broadcaster's local radio station for Bristol. BBC Radio Bristol will not broadcast its regular programming on 1548 kHz. Transmissions continue as normal on FM (104.9 and/or 94.9 MHz), on DAB digital radio, on iPlayer Radio and via its newest outlet on Freeview digital television channel 719.

Tyneside To Host Second BBC 6 Music Festival - Bands including The War on Drugs, The Fall and Maximo Park will play at BBC radio station 6 Music's second festival in Newcastle and Gateshead next month. 6 Music will broadcast gigs from venues including the Sage Gateshead and the O2 Academy Newcastle from 20-22 February. Other acts on the line-up will include Hot Chip, Young Fathers, Neneh Cherry, Interpol, Jon Hopkins, Kate Tempest, The Charlatans, Villagers and Jungle. It comes a year after the first 6 Music Festival took place in Manchester.

Reach Graham at +44 7752 416905. Twitter: @GrahamMack Web: www.mackmedia.co.uk Email: graham@mackmedia.co.uk

Cipha Sounds Exits Hot 97 After Voicing Frustration With Station On Podcast

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– In a story you read first in yesterday's Jockline, 17 year Hot 97 mainstay, Cipha Sounds took to a podcast to air his frustrations with the station after being displaced in afternoons by the arrival of Nessa. Sounds had been filling the slot following Angie Martinez' move to Power 105 last summer. Less than 24 hours after Cipha's appearance on Juan Epstein's podcast, the station issued a statement saying ""Effective immediately, Cipha Sounds is no longer with WQHT HOT 97 FM. We wish him well on his future endeavors." Sounds then released his own statement, writing, 'After 17 years, I’m leaving Hot 97. I’m changing my relationship status from “it’s complicated” to “single”. It’s been an amazing ride – from intern to weekends to morning show host to fill Angie’s seat in afternoons ... The next move is already underway and I promise it’s going to be huge. Follow me at @ciphasounds. On the podcast with fellow Hot 97 co-host, Peter Rosenberg, he said once Angie Martinez left for Power 105.1 and he took over her time slot and wasn’t sure if the position was permanent. Cipha added, “One boss told me one thing, another boss told me another thing, they then fired one of those bosses, another boss came in an told me one thing, and then a boss of another station came in and became our boss and told me another thing." Last month, it was announced that Martinez’s slot would be taken over by Nessa Nitty who began this week.

LISTEN TO PODCAST HERE - WARNING STRONG LANGUAGE

MOTION: 107.5 WGCI Chicago Cast New Morning Show

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 27TH, 2015 –– 107.5 WGCI announced that Kyle Santillian, Kendra G will join Leon Rogers and host mornings, effective January 29, 2015. “We’ve signed Chicago’s next big morning show,” said Derrick Brown, Director of Urban Programming, iHeartMedia Chicago. Kyle, Kendra and Leon are one-of-a-kind entertainers, but most importantly, they have a heart for the community. They won’t hesitate to tackle tough issues our listeners confront or step in to lend a helping hand. ”Kyle Santillian most recently hosted mornings on 102 Jamz in Greensboro, N.C. "I’m extremely excited to be joining the team at WGCI,” said Santillian. “I look forward to contributing to the legacy that WGCI has built throughout the years!”Kendra G, a native of Connecticut, is a graduate of Hampton University and former morning show co-host at WPWX-FM in Chicago and WVEE-FM in Atlanta. Most recently, Kendra G hosted Coca-Cola Red Carpet LIVE for the 2014 American Music Awards. Leon Rogers joined 107.5 WGCI nearly ten years ago and is best known to WGCI listeners as “The Destined Legend” and host of “Leon’s Lock Room.”“I’m excited to have Kyle and Kendra G join the team,” said Rogers. “Time to dominate!

Cumulus 93.9 The Beat Brings Classic Hip Hop To Indianapolis

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– Cumulus announces that WRWM-FM/i94 launched this week as 93.9 The Beat, Indianapolis’ Classic Hip Hop station. The former Top 40 station, which moved to Classic Hip Hop programming in December, kicked off its debut week as 93.9 The Beat. Mike McVay, Senior Vice President, Programming for Cumulus said: “We’re excited to have this format in our stable. First in wins and we’re already seeing the spoils of victory.” Jay Michaels, Program Director, WRWM-FM, said: “The response from Indy on our new radio station has been more than positive, both from listeners and advertisers. This format is the rhythmic answer to “HOT AC” – and has already proven to be Indy’s new favorite radio station. I couldn’t be prouder to lead the new ’93.9 The Beat’ to victory!”

Casey Tate Joins Gene & Julie Show As Producer

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– Just as Drex, Cassiday & Tingle launch their new morning show on Star 94 Atlanta, it was announced that longtime WSTR producer, Casey Tate (inset) is headed to Mix 101.5/WRAL-FM Raleigh where he'll join The Gene And Julie show as it newly created producer/on air contributor. As previously reported, Drex and Cassiday most recently served as members of the Drex and Maney show WNKS/Kiss 95.1 Charlotte, Tingle arrived from WRDW/Wired 96.5 - Philadelphia. Gene and Julie told Jockline, 'We couldn't be happier by being joined with Casey. His talent, experience and attitude will take our show to a whole new level."

[WATCH] Johnny Magic Gets Sweet Revenge On Co-Host

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– Those lookin for a new way to take a show-piece viral, check it out. It has been over a year since XL 106.7/Orlando co-host, Laura Diaz pranked Johnny with old photos of Johnny in a thong, lathered up in oil and plastered on billboards throughout central Florida. Now, it 's Johnny's turn. It seems he came across some old photos of his partner that, let's say, may have revealed more than she would have preferred others to see, the least of which, an entire audience. UH OH, too late, as Johnny decided to put Laura through the same drill he went through a year ago. AND NOT JUST ONE BILLBOARD! Try over 20 locations throughout the city. He even conveniently posted all the locations at the website (R). Meanwhile, viewers are mounting quickly on YOUTUBE. SEE MORE HERE

EXECUTIVE ACTION: Paul O’Malley To Lead New High-Level Sales Post For WWO; Moving Dallas Operations To Other Facilities

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– Westwood One announced that it has promoted Cumulus VP, Brand Solutions Paul O’Malley to Senior Vice-President, Strategic Sales Partnerships, for Westwood One. This newly-created Strategic Sales division will specialize in programs such as Red Carpet Radio music and entertainment events, print, NASH, live concerts, and more. Based in Atlanta and reporting to Steve Shaw, Westwood One President, he said ,“I am excited by the opportunity to deliver experiential solutions which will encompass national scale and local engagement.'

In related news, it was announced that Westwood One's lease on its Dallas offices and studios on Montfort Drive will be up in mid-2015 and they have elected to move their Dallas operations to other facilities. Westwood One will build out broadcast facilities at its TM Studios location on Academy Lane in Dallas, and will move programming, production and affiliate sales there. Back-office functions, like traffic and affiliate service/affidavit management will be relocated to an existing Cumulus facility in nearby Arlington, TX. Other than some duplicated facility support positions, there will be no other changes to staffing related to the relocations.

SYNDICATION: Billy Madison Show On The Rise Nationally; Sean Hannity Now On 720 KDWN/Las Vegas; Sunday Night Slow Jams Adds 12

BILLY MADISON SHOW SYNDICATION SHOWING SIGNS OF SUCCESS Nineball Radio Networks LLC is an independent creator and clearance house for terrestrial radio programming and services and the syndication company that licenses The Billy Madison Show, available for Rock stations nationwide Monday through Friday mornings. The Billy Madison Show is currently heard on KISS-FM (KISS ROCKS), in San Antonio, TX and WHPT-FM (THE BONE), in Tampa, FL. The Billy Madison Show has commanded a number one market share in all male demos in both markets. At the start of the Fall '14 book the show debuted in morning drive on WXNX-FM (Sun Broadcasting)in Fort Myers, FL. According to Nineball Radio Networks' President/ CEO Stefan Jones, "Planting your flag in the sand in your first syndication market can always be a little nerve-racking but the results are in and Billy is a proven winner. He boosted morning drive across ALL demos and went from 10th to 4th in Men 18-49 in one book! We could not be happier. ######### The Sean Hannity show now adds AM 720 KDWN WHO: AM 720 KDWN/Las Vegas to its on-air lineup. The Sean Hannity Show premieres Monday, February 2, 2015 on AM 720 KDWN and will air live from noon to 3:00 p.m. weekdays is heard by more than 11 million listeners each week on more than 500 affiliates ######## Benztown Radio Networks announced today that nationally syndicated radio show, Sunday Night Slow Jams, has added 12 new affiliates in the first month of 2015. The new affiliates include KCDZ-FM, Joshua Tree, CA KKPL-FM, Fort Collins, CO KTFM-FM, San Antonio, TX KTOY-FM, Shreveport, LA KZGF-FM, Fargo-Valley City, ND WHIZ-FM, Zanesville, OH WXYY-FM, Savannah, GA KBHT-FM, Waco-Temple-Bryan, TX WGNG-FM, Jackson, MS WZZA-AM, Huntsville-Decatur, AL KZGF-FM, Grand Forks, ND SMOOTH 106.2, Nicosia, Cyprus

[WATCH] Ryan Seacrest And Jimmy Fallon Share AT40 Stories On 'The Tonight Show'

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– Ryan Seacrest recently appeared as a guest on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon to talk about the 14th season of American Idol. During the interview, Seacrest shared that as a kid, he would set up a Radio Shack mixer in his bedroom and make tapes pretending to be AT40’s original host and creator Casey Kasem, who would ask Seacrest to introduce the #1 song of the week. Seacrest and Fallon also chatted about how shocked they were when Fallon’s song "Ew!" featuring will.i.am made the Top 40 chart. Click the following link to view the episode of The Tonight Show, during which Seacrest and Fallon teamed up for a game of Charades against actress Taraji P. Henson and The Roots’ Tariq: About American Top 40 American Top 40 with Ryan Seacrest, the number one countdown show in the U.S., is syndicated by Premiere Networks on nearly 500 stations worldwide. The show, which is executive produced by Claudine Cazian, can be heard by approximately 5 million weekly listeners worldwide in markets such as New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, San Francisco, Dallas, Boston, Houston, Washington, D.C., Singapore, Shanghai, Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver, Kuala Lumpur, Dubai, Beijing, Dublin, Moscow, Berlin and many others. WATCH HERE

TSBC6 UPDATE: Stephen A. Smith Joins Friday Sport's Panel Lineup

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– Next Friday's blockbuster sports' panel at TSBC6 in Atlanta just got kicked up a notch with the addition of radio and TV star, Stephen A. Smith - Led by Bruce Gilbert, SVP sports programming for Cumulus Media and scheduled for 3:30 pm on Friday 2.6 At The W Hotel In Buck head/Atlanta, Smith will join panelists Rich Shertenlieb - 98.5 The Sports Hub Boston Steve Gorman - Premiere Networks Los Angeles, Amy Lawrence - CBS Radio Sports Network New York , Christopher Rude - 680 The Fan Atlanta and Terry Foxx - 92.9 The Game. With the fusion of more entertainment content in sports talk programming, they'll tackle content beyond the scores and stats. TO REGISTER, OR FOR MORE DETAILS, VISIT http://www.talkshowbootcamp.com

XAPPmedia and jacapps Announce Partnership

THE MOUTH, JANUARY 28TH, 2015 –– XAPPmedia, provider of the first interactive audio advertising service, and jacapps, the nation's leading provider of mobile apps to the radio industry, today announced a partnership to establish JAX, a new mobile audience premium ad service. The partnership will integrate the XAPP Interactive Audio Ad Service into jacapps, the mobile platform created by Jacobs Media, and allow commercial and public radio stations to monetize their mobile apps with XAPP Ads. The JAX mobile monetization solution will include ad sales and will be available to radio stations using the jacapps mobile platform. Jaccapps President Paul Jacobs said, "XAPP Ads provide a simple and effective way to drive consumer engagement and higher ROI, which in turn increases CPMs. The JAX solution will help radio broadcasters substantially improve their mobile monetization." Launched by the Jacobs Media team, they understand the needs of radio broadcasters as well as the highly competitive mobile audio space. It's imperative for radio broadcasters to have the tools and guidance to build mobile audiences and generate new revenue sources. Advertisers are willing to pay a premium price for XAPP Ads because they deliver high consumer engagement rates on mobile. The JAX solution from jacapps is an ideal platform to bring these advertisers to radio."
